text.text:
Hi $USER!

 *Here are some things I can do for you:*

*Trivia*
:nerd_face:
 An admin of the channel can run a trivia game using the global shortcut.

*Pairs*
:smiley: :smile:
 Type '/pair' to create conversational pairs within the channel. Each pair is then assigned a conversational topic. The command is restricted to admins.

*Karma*
:100:
 React to a user's comment with :yay: if they've been helpful to give them karma. Type '/karma' to see the current leaderboard. At certain point thresholds of karma, users are given awards.

*Anonymous Messages*
:man_in_business_suit_levitating:
 Using the global and message shortcuts you can send messages anonymously to people and channels.

*Events*
:tada:
 Type '/events' to find new events happening at UNSW soon using LinkUp.

*Course Summaries*
:book:
 Type '/course {coursename}' to get a summary of that course including prerequisites, term dates, and student reviews.

*Review a Course*
:computer:
 If you'd like to leave a review of a course, type '/review {coursename}'. You can leave reviews on the course and lecturer and rate courses on difficulty and enjoyment.

*CS Job Opportunities*
:money_with_wings:
 Type '/CSopportunites' to see a list of available CS internship and graduate job opportunities. Information about the role will be provided alongside advice for applying.

*Stylechecker*
:male-technologist:
 Type '/stylechecker' to upload a file to be stylechecked with a linter.

*Timetabler*
:calendar:
 Type '/timetable' to start a modal that lets you customise your term timetable using Notangles.

*Important*
:heavy_exclamation_mark:
 Type '/important {message}' to send an important message to a channel. This will send an email notification to all members of the channel. Only available to admins of a channel.

*Purge*
:file_cabinet:
 Type '/purge {count} {@user | time}' to delete the last n messages either sent by a user or since a set time within the given channel. Only admins can purge messages.

*Profile*
:bust_in_silhouette:
 Type '/profile {@user}' to see useful information about a user. This will show their interests, current courses and karma earned in the Slackspace.

*Freerooms*
:door:
 Type '/freerooms' to help find available rooms nearby using CSESOC's Freerooms.

*FAQ*
:robot_face:
To see commonly asked questions, type '/FAQ'.
